703317f-b.text:
(1)
Brighton Beach Ave., south side, East 4th Street and Coney Island Ave. showing the Brighton Beach Hotel, which was built by the Brighton Beach Co., in 1878, and opened for business the same year. The work was started on March 20, 1878. When this hotel was first erected it was 600 feet from high water, but in 1888 the Atlantic had undermined the foundations necessitating the placing of the hotel upon piles. However on April 3, 1888 it was moved inland 500 feet by B.C. Miller and 5 Sons who contracted the work. The hotel was razed in 1924. The owners or lessees of this hotel were Breslin and Sweet 1879, Leland 1883, Cunningham and Hatfield 1888, and E. Clark King 1902-1909.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, viewed eastward.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, a front view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same, showing a side view of the hotel, the hand-ball court, the grand-stand and the merry-go-round.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703317f-b.folder: Brighton Beach Avenue & 4th Street (East), Brooklyn, NY

703318f-a.text:
Brighton Beach Avenue, south side, at East 4th Street and Coney Island Avenue, showing the Brighton Beach Hotel. See
other views for more data.
December 31, 1938
Photographer Geo P. Hall & Co.
Urbrock Collection
